title: Spinal Cord Anatomy
subject: Anatomy
description: Questions about the organization of the nervous system, spinal cord structure, segments, meninges, and clinical aspects

questions.questionText: Which of the following is part of the central nervous system (CNS)?
questions.explanation: The CNS consists of the brain and spinal cord, while cranial and spinal nerves are part of the PNS.

questions.questionText: How many pairs of cranial nerves are there?
questions.explanation: There are 12 pairs of cranial nerves connected to the brain stem.

questions.questionText: The parasympathetic division of the autonomic nervous system is also known as:
questions.explanation: The parasympathetic division arises from cranial and sacral regions.

questions.questionText: The spinal cord occupies which portion of the vertebral canal?
questions.explanation: The spinal cord occupies the upper 2/3 of the vertebral canal.
references: Netter's Atlas of Human Anatomy, 7th Edition

questions.questionText: What is the approximate length of the spinal cord in adult males?
questions.explanation: The spinal cord is about 45 cm in males and 42 cm in females.

questions.questionText: The spinal cord begins as a continuation of which structure?
questions.explanation: It continues from the medulla oblongata at the lower border of the foramen magnum.

questions.questionText: At birth, the spinal cord ends at the level of which vertebra?
questions.explanation: At birth, it ends at L3, and in adults at the L1/L2 disc due to differential growth.

questions.questionText: The cervical enlargement of the spinal cord corresponds to which segments?
questions.explanation: The cervical enlargement is from C5-T1, giving origin to the brachial plexus.
references: Netter's Atlas of Human Anatomy, 7th Edition

questions.questionText: Which sulcus on the spinal cord is the deepest?
questions.explanation: The anterior median fissure is the deepest groove on the spinal cord.

questions.questionText: The dorsal roots of spinal nerves enter through which sulci?
questions.explanation: Dorsal (sensory) roots enter via the posterolateral sulci.

questions.questionText: How many spinal cord segments are there in total?
questions.explanation: There are 31 segments: 8 cervical, 12 thoracic, 5 lumbar, 5 sacral, 1 coccygeal.

questions.questionText: The dorsal root of a spinal nerve contains which type of fibers?
questions.explanation: The dorsal root consists of sensory fibers and carries the dorsal root ganglion.
references: Netter's Atlas of Human Anatomy, 7th Edition

questions.questionText: After uniting, the spinal nerve trunk divides into:
questions.explanation: The mixed spinal nerve divides into anterior and posterior rami.

questions.questionText: According to the rule for vertebral levels, the C5 spine is opposite to which segment?
questions.explanation: In the cervical region, add one: C5 spine opposite C6 segment.

questions.questionText: The T10 spine is opposite to which spinal segment?
questions.explanation: In lower thoracic, add 3: T10 spine opposite L1 segment.

questions.questionText: Cervical nerves C1 to C7 emerge:
questions.explanation: C1-C7 emerge above, C8 above T1, and others below.
references: Netter's Atlas of Human Anatomy, 7th Edition

questions.questionText: The cauda equina consists of:
questions.explanation: It's a leash of lumbar and sacral roots descending to their exit foramina.

questions.questionText: The meninges surrounding the spinal cord from inside out are:
questions.explanation: The order is pia mater (inner), arachnoid, dura mater (outer).

questions.questionText: The spinal pia mater is closely adherent to:
questions.explanation: The pia mater is a delicate membrane closely adherent to the spinal cord.

questions.questionText: How many processes does each denticulate ligament have?
questions.explanation: Each denticulate ligament has 21 serrated processes anchoring to the dura.
references: Netter's Atlas of Human Anatomy, 7th Edition

questions.questionText: The filum terminale extends from the conus medullaris to:
questions.explanation: It attaches to the back of the coccyx after piercing the arachnoid and dura at S2.

questions.questionText: The spinal arachnoid mater ends at the level of:
questions.explanation: It ends at S2, continuous with the brain's arachnoid mater.

questions.questionText: The subarachnoid space contains all except:
questions.explanation: The subarachnoid space contains CSF, vessels, and roots; the venous plexus is in the extradural space.

questions.questionText: The spinal dura mater extends from the foramen magnum to:
questions.explanation: It extends down to the S2 vertebra.
references: Netter's Atlas of Human Anatomy, 7th Edition

questions.questionText: The extradural space lodges:
questions.explanation: The extradural (epidural) space contains the venous plexus and spinal nerve roots.

questions.questionText: The lumbar cistern extends from:
questions.explanation: It is the lower subarachnoid space from L2 to S2, devoid of spinal cord.

questions.questionText: The contents of the lumbar cistern include all except:
questions.explanation: It is devoid of spinal cord but contains CSF, cauda equina, and filum terminale.

questions.questionText: Lumbar puncture is safely performed below which level to avoid spinal cord injury?
questions.explanation: It is safe below L2 vertebra as the spinal cord ends at L1/L2.
references: Netter's Atlas of Human Anatomy, 7th Edition

questions.questionText: Which structure anchors the spinal cord to the dura mater laterally?
questions.explanation: Denticulate ligaments anchor the cord laterally to the dura.

questions.questionText: The subarachnoid septum attaches the spinal cord to the dura mater:
questions.explanation: It is a backward extension attaching posteriorly.

questions.questionText: The dura mater is attached above to:
questions.explanation: The dura is attached to the margin of the foramen magnum and intervertebral foramina.

questions.questionText: The linea splendens is a thickening of the pia mater along:
questions.explanation: It is a median glistening band along the anterior median fissure.
references: Netter's Atlas of Human Anatomy, 7th Edition

questions.questionText: The sympathetic division of the ANS is:
questions.explanation: The sympathetic division is thoracolumbar.

questions.questionText: The conus medullaris is the tapered lower end of:
questions.explanation: The lower end of the spinal cord tapers into the conus medullaris.

questions.questionText: In the 3rd month of intrauterine life, the spinal cord occupies:
questions.explanation: By the 3rd month, it occupies the whole vertebral canal.

questions.questionText: The lumbar enlargement gives origin to plexuses for:
questions.explanation: From L1-S3, it gives origin to lumbar and sacral plexuses.
references: Netter's Atlas of Human Anatomy, 7th Edition

questions.questionText: The dorsal root ganglion is located on:
questions.explanation: Each dorsal root carries an oval swelling called the dorsal root ganglion.

questions.questionText: T11 spine is opposite to which segments?
questions.explanation: T11 spine is opposite to L2 to L5 segments.

questions.questionText: The subdural space separates:
questions.explanation: It is a narrow space between arachnoid and dura mater.

questions.questionText: Which is not a prolongation of the spinal dura mater?
questions.explanation: Dura forms sheaths around roots, trunks, and filum terminale, but not specifically around conus.
references: Netter's Atlas of Human Anatomy, 7th Edition
